questions.text: A full term baby was born 16 hours ago. As you are the chief paediatrician available, they called you for a regular visit. You assessed the baby and everything were normal, you informed the parents and made a note of it. The doubtful father asks you that the baby hasn’t passed its first motion or urine yet. Is there any abnormalities? What will be reply about the normal time that you should wait for the passing of urine and meconium?
questions.correct_answer: A. Urine 24 hrs and Meconium 48 hrs.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Urine 24 hrs and Meconium 48 hrs.

questions.text: A mother has just started breast feeding her 2.5 kg newborn who has born from normal vaginal delivery. Which of the following is not true about breast milk?
Calculate my ponderal index - I am 1200 grams and length of 42 cm and also tell me which type it fits into?

I am newborn who presented with scalp swelling which became to its maximum size by 24 hours. Doctor said nothing to worry, he said it will take 3-6 weeks to resolve. What do you think I am suffering from?

A 3-day old baby’s mother came to the Pediatric OPD. She is concerned that whenever she breast feeds her baby, her baby sleeps comfortably but after every 30 minutes the baby wakes up and starts crying. On further evaluation, you find that the mother has been breastfeeding the baby correctly, however the baby feeds for just 5-10 minutes after which he goes to sleep. What could be the possible cause of frequent awakening in the baby?

options.label: A
options.text: Baby is crying because the diaper is wet

options.label: B
options.text: The quality of the mother’s feed is not good

options.label: C
options.text: Baby is getting only foremilk, the satiety value is missing

options.label: D
options.text: We should rule out neonatal sepsis

questions.correct_answer: C. Baby is getting only foremilk, the satiety value is missing
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Baby is getting only foremilk, the satiety value is missing

questions.text: Match the following vaccines in the options given below. MMR OPV Rotavirus Smallpox Chicken Pox Live Killed

A 27-day old male baby was brought by his mother with complaints of projectile vomiting. On examination, a mass is felt on PA and shows the movement of peristalsis from left side to the right side. On proceeding with Ultrasonography, target sign was noted and on blood examination, Serum potassium levels were found to be decreased and acidic urine is noted. Which drug may have a prenatal role in development of the following condition?

A 3-day old newborn came with yellowish discolouration of body. On further evaluation, it came out that mother is B negative, and baby is B positive. How much bilirubin is normally produced by breakdown of one gm of hemoglobin?

Match the following clinical findings with their diagnosis. Clinical findings Delayed passage of Meconium Red currant Jelly Stools Peri anal rash with acidic stools Metabolic alkalosis with paradoxical aciduria Diagnosis Intussusception Infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis Hirschsprungs disease Lactose intolerance

A 16-year-old child presents with refractory seizures. MRI brain shows multiple ring-enhancing lesions as shown in the image. MR spectroscopy shows elevated choline, alanine and lactate levels. What is the probable diagnosis?
Which of the following conditions is associated with MACEWAN SIGN ?

A 2.5 kg baby born through LSCS cried immediately after birth. On the routine visit pediatrician noticed that baby has macroglossia with hemihypertrophy of limbs. What is your best possible diagnosis?
Which mechanism in phototherapy is chiefly responsible for reduction in serum bilirubin?
A 3-day old newborn came with hypoglycemia which was not corrected after giving repeated bolus of glucose. Which is the Most common vitamin deficiency can cause neonatal seizure?

A mother brings her 8-month-old child Saheli for a routine visit. She complaints that her child is having chronic diarrhoea for more than a month and has failure to thrive. On examination, Saheli had abdominal distension and facial pallor. Routine CBC revealed the presence of severe anemia. On asking history, the mother informed that these symptoms started when she weaned her off from the breast milk and started on supplementary feeds. On further evaluation, she is found to have hypersensitivity to gluten in her foods. Which of the following is not allowed in this condition?
Which of the following in not a criteria of severe acute malnutrition by WHO?
A 4-year-old Child came with fever + stridor + swallowing difficulty with drooling of saliva within 4-6 hours. Which of the following treatment is required?
A girl of 6 years age can climb up stairs with alternate feet, ride a tricycle, can remember name, age but cannot narrate stories. What is her actual developmental age?
The milestone of a 3-year-old child are considered delayed if he is unable to:
A 3-year-old child on a school health check-up found to have rashes over his face which was similar to the rashes of one more student who was his best friend. Identify the disease?
A mother came for the BCG vaccination of her newborn baby. Which of the following is true about the vaccine?

options.label: A
options.text: Distilled water is used as diluent

options.label: B
options.text: Site of injection is cleaned with spirit

options.label: D
options.text: WHO recommend DANISH 1331 for vaccine production

questions.correct_answer: D. WHO recommend DANISH 1331 for vaccine production
questions.explanation: Ans. D) WHO recommend DANISH 1331 for vaccine production

questions.text: Which of the following is an effective sign of neonatal resuscitation is?

A 5-year-old child came with mother with complaints of not being attentive in the class. His peers make fun of him due to unusual face look and early change in colour of hair. What is the best diagnosis?

Lizy is a 4-year-old girl who has been experiencing developmental delays since birth. She has difficulty with motor skills, including walking and using her hands. She also has trouble communicating with others, has a hand wringing movement and often appears to be in her own world. Her parents have taken her to numerous doctors and specialists, but none have been able to provide a definitive diagnosis. What can be the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most commonest cause of the condition shown in the image and is this true that this condition can cause viral myocarditis?

options.label: C
options.text: Hand foot and mouth disease, false

options.label: D
options.text: Hand foot and mouth disease, true

questions.correct_answer: D. Hand foot and mouth disease, true
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Hand foot and mouth disease, true

questions.text: Which of the following is the most reliable first trimester investigation for the ante natal screening of the condition shown in the image?
questions.correct_answer: A. Pregnancy Associated Plasma Protein A
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Pregnancy Associated Plasma Protein A

questions.text: Name the method of loosing heat as shown in the image below:

Match the following conditions and their presentations. Stage 1 Hypoxic Ischemic Encephalopathy Stage 2 Hypoxic Ischemic Encephalopathy Stage 3 Hypoxic Ischemic Encephalopathy Hyper Alert + Mydriasis + Strong Moro + Hyperactive Reflexes Miosis + Weak Moro + Seizures Decerebrate + Absent Moro + Unequal Pupil
A newborn baby born through normal vaginal delivery. The vitals were stable and delayed cord clamping was done. Identify two drawbacks of delayed cord clamping during delivery?
A 1-minute old newborn was assessed by the duty doctor. He planned to do it by doing APGAR score. What does APGAR stands for?
questions.correct_answer: B. Appearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, Respiration
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Appearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, Respiration

questions.text: A 4-and-a-half-year-old child who was mostly on bottle feeding with water came for routine check-up. Anganwadi worker noticed the look of the baby and advised for admission. What is the best possible diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: This baby follows the theory of dysadaptation

questions.text: 5-year-old came with complaints of fever, altered sensorium and headache. Meningeal signs were positive. A diagnosis of tubercular meningitis was estimated. What is the possible CSF findings in the child?

options.label: A
options.text: Low sugar, high protein, lymphocytic predominance

options.label: B
options.text: High sugar, high protein, lymphocytic predominance

options.label: C
options.text: Low sugar, low protein, lymphocytic predominance

options.label: D
options.text: Low sugar, high protein, neutrophilic predominance

questions.correct_answer: A. Low sugar, high protein, lymphocytic predominance

questions.text: Calculate the daily energy requirement in kilocalories for an 84 kg boy?
In which of the diseases is the following appearance of calves seen in a child?

A 6-day old neonate weighing 2800 gm (birth weight 3000 gm) was brought with the complaints of fever, poor feeding and poor activity. There was no history of vomiting or diarrhea. Axillary temperature was 39°C with depressed fontenalle, sunken eyes, decreased urine output and decreased skin turgor. Her mother has the history of decreased milk production. What is your diagnosis?
10 hours old baby is planned for examination. Expanded new Ballard score was done. What is minimum and maximum scoring is given to Ballard score?

You saw a child who runs well and can climb upstairs and downstairs with one step at a time. You remembered that your pediatric teacher yesterday explained about the development of milestones. When is the next milestone of climbing steps with alternate feet expected to be developed?

A mother brings her infant for routine vaccination. As you are an intern moving here and there, she noticed you and asked you about yourself. When you were talking the baby grasped a toy as shown in the image and tried to eat it. Her mother suddenly picked the toy and threw it. At which age does the following mature finger grasp develops?

A baby was recently delivered in the labor room. The mother was found to have diabetes. After the delivery of the infant of diabetic mother, blood glucose of the infant was measured to be 60 mg/dl. What other investigation does the sister expect that the physician would ask her to do next?
Rahul is 12-year-old. He is asking his expected height. Choose the best statement(s) after seeing the image?

options.label: A
options.text: The instrument is a stadiometer and Rahul's expected height is around 150 cm

options.label: B
options.text: This instrument is infantometer and Rahul's expected height is around 150 cm

options.label: C
options.text: Instrument name is stadiometer and Rahul's expected height is around 150 cm and the formulae to calculate is age multiply 6 + 77

questions.correct_answer: D. A and C are correct
questions.explanation: Ans. D) A and C are correct

questions.text: A neonate presented with cicatrizing skin lesions all over the body with hypoplasia of all limbs. An MRI of the brain revealed diffuse cerebral atrophy. An ophthalmologic evaluation reveals chorioretinitis. Which of these tests is most likely to show a positive result in this patient?
What should be the ideal temperature in delivery room for the neonates to be kept in warmer?
Ideal route of drug delivery in neonatal resuscitation is:
This is a coronary angiogram of a patient suffering from Kawasaki. To qualify as giant aneurysm, internal diameter of coronary artery should be more than:
Match the following: Nakayama strain Oka strain Edmonston Zagreb strain Jeryl lynn strain Mumps Measles Varicella Japanese Encephalitis

2 days old newborn baby had a history of delayed cry. 24 hours after the evaluation baby had an abnormal movement which was in the form of staring look and fixating of eyes. Which type of neonatal seizure best describes the condition?
A mother brings her 4-year-old girl whose father is 180 cm and mother is 170 cm. Calculate the mid parental height.
A 4-year-old child came with a height of 120 cm against an expected height of 100 cm. Which of the following is not a cause of tall stature?
A 5-year-old child with endocrine disorder was being evaluated for short stature. Which type of short stature does the graph represents?
A 6 months old baby was on pamidronate. He had a history of brittle bone disease. What is the triad of this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Blue sclera / thick bones / early deafness

options.label: B
options.text: Blue sclera / fragile bones / late deafness

options.label: C
options.text: Purple sclera / fragile bones / early deafness

options.label: D
options.text: Blue sclera / fragile bones / early deafness

questions.correct_answer: D. Blue sclera / fragile bones / early deafness
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Blue sclera / fragile bones / early deafness

questions.text: Match the following classification with the conditions given below? Osteogenesis imperfecta Tracheoesophageal fistula Hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy Modified bell’s staging Silence Classification Gross Classification Sarnat & Amp; Sarnat Staging Necrotising Enterocolitis
Which of the following infection have No / Low risk of perinatal transmission?

Match the following cardiological conditions in children with their typical chest X-ray findings: Cardiological conditions X-ray Coarctation of Aorta TAPVC Transposition of Great Arteries Tetralogy of fallot Egg on String appearance Coeur en sabot appearance Figure of 8 appearance Figure of 3 appearance

A full-term newborn is examined on the second day of life and has passed a blackish green, sticky, tarry stool. What is the most likely explanation for this stool color, and what should be the next step in management?

options.label: D
options.text: Malabsorption syndrome; Order a barium enema

questions.correct_answer: A. Meconium stool; Continue routine care
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Meconium stool; Continue routine care

questions.text: What is the recommended dose of steroids for attaining fetal lung maturity?

options.label: A
options.text: Inj. betamethasone 12 mg for 2 doses 12 hours apart

options.label: B
options.text: Inj. betamethasone 12 mg for 2 doses 24 hours apart

options.label: C
options.text: Inj. dexamethasone 6 mg for 4 doses 24 hours apart

options.label: D
options.text: Inj. dexamethasone 12 mg for 2 doses 12 hours apart

questions.correct_answer: B. Inj. betamethasone 12 mg for 2 doses 24 hours apart
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Inj. betamethasone 12 mg for 2 doses 24 hours apart

questions.text: All of the following are sequelae of a syndrome where the patient presents with smooth philtrum with thin upper lip except:
The following type of blood sample is used in which conditions in a newborn?
A 4-days-old neonate is brought by the mother to the pediatrician and is found to have a bilirubin of 18 g/dl. What is the next step?
questions.correct_answer: B. Start phototherapy and continue breastfeeding
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Start phototherapy and continue breastfeeding

questions.text: During a routine neonatal examination, you observe a bluish-black, flat patch on the sacral area of a term newborn. The baby is otherwise healthy and full-term. What is the most likely diagnosis for this skin finding, and what advice would you provide to the parents regarding this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Café-au-lait macule; Refer to a pediatric dermatologist for evaluation.

options.label: B
options.text: Mongolian spot; Reassure the parents that it is a benign condition and typically fades over time.

options.label: C
options.text: Port-wine stain; Initiate laser therapy for early treatment.

options.label: D
options.text: Hemangioma; Administer oral propranolol for rapid resolution.

questions.correct_answer: B. Mongolian spot; Reassure the parents that it is a benign condition and typically fades over time.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Mongolian spot; Reassure the parents that it is a benign condition and typically fades over time.

questions.text: A final year MBBS is teaching milestone to a third year. Which of the following mile stone is seen in the image and when does it come?

A preterm infant is born at 32 weeks gestation, and the medical team needs to assess the infant’s gestational age accurately. Which assessment tool is most appropriate for determining the gestational age of this newborn, and what are the key parameters evaluated in this tool?

options.label: A
options.text: Apgar score; Assess heart rate, respiratory effort, muscle tone, reflex irritability, and color.

options.label: B
options.text: Ballard Score; Evaluate physical and neuromuscular characteristics, including skin, lanugo, plantar creases, and breast tissue.

options.label: C
options.text: Capurro Score; Examine the infant’s ear, eye, breast, genitalia, and skin to determine maturity.

options.label: D
options.text: Silverman-Anderson Score; Evaluate respiratory distress in preterm infants based on retractions, expiratory grunt, and nasal flaring.

questions.correct_answer: B. Ballard Score; Evaluate physical and neuromuscular characteristics, including skin, lanugo, plantar creases, and breast tissue.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Ballard Score; Evaluate physical and neuromuscular characteristics, including skin, lanugo, plantar creases, and breast tissue.

questions.text: A full-term newborn is found to have extensive lanugo covering the body during a physical examination. What is the most likely underlying reason for the presence of lanugo in this neonate, and how should it be managed?

options.label: D
options.text: Baby is sick – needs surfactant therapy

questions.text: A premature newborn is born at 28 weeks gestation and presents with rapid, shallow breathing, grunting, nasal flaring, and cyanosis shortly after birth. Chest X- ray reveals a ground-glass appearance with diffuse, fine reticular opacities. What is the most likely diagnosis for this infant’s respiratory condition, and what is the underlying pathophysiology?

options.label: A
options.text: Transient tachypnea of the newborn (TTN); Delayed clearance of fetal lung fluid causing respiratory distress.

options.label: B
options.text: Meconium aspiration syndrome; Airway obstruction due to meconium in the air passages.

options.label: C
options.text: Neonatal pneumonia; Infection of the lung tissue causing diffuse opacities.

options.label: D
options.text: Hyaline membrane disease (respiratory distress syndrome); Deficiency of surfactant leading to alveolar collapse.

questions.correct_answer: D. Hyaline membrane disease (respiratory distress syndrome); Deficiency of surfactant leading to alveolar collapse.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Hyaline membrane disease (respiratory distress syndrome); Deficiency of surfactant leading to alveolar collapse

questions.text: A newborn requiring resuscitation is not responding adequately to initial measures, and the heart rate remains below the target range despite effective ventilation and oxygenation. According to Neonatal Resuscitation Program (NRP) guidelines, what is the appropriate dose and route of administration for adrenaline (epinephrine) in neonatal resuscitation?
questions.correct_answer: C. 0.02 mg/kg (IV) administration / 0.1 mg endotracheal administration
questions.explanation: Ans. C) 0.02 mg/kg (IV) administration / 0.1 mg endotracheal administration

questions.text: A full-term newborn presents with poor feeding shortly after birth. A point-of-care glucose measurement shows a blood glucose level of 38 mg/dL (2.2mmol/L). What is the most appropriate initial step in the management of this infant hypoglycemia?

options.label: A
options.text: Initiate an intravenous (IV) bolus of glucose.

options.label: C
options.text: Continue feeding and monitor glucose levels.

questions.correct_answer: A. Initiate an intravenous (IV) bolus of glucose.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Initiate an intravenous (IV) bolus of glucose

questions.text: A twin baby born with the following defect. How would you best describe this anomaly?
A 3-month-old baby with the findings shown below. On further examination baby was found to have chorioretinitis. What is the most likely diagnosis?
At what pressure pop valve is released in bag and mask ventilation?
A mother delivers a 2.5 kg baby with normal vaginal delivery in a rural area. Which of the following is an incorrect statement?

options.label: B
options.text: Bath the baby with warm water immediately

questions.correct_answer: B. Bath the baby with warm water immediately
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Bath the baby with warm water immediately

questions.text: Which of the following is correct regarding the growth and development of a baby?

options.label: A
options.text: Height increases by 25 cm by 1st year

options.label: D
options.text: Baby’s weight increases by 300 grams per month

questions.correct_answer: A. Height increases by 25 cm by 1st year
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Height increases by 25 cm by 1st year

questions.text: A 4-year-old child with seizures. What is the first line of management pertaining to “D” – TABCDE
A newborn baby 2.5 kg born through normal delivery. Due to severe anemia mother expired suddenly on the table Which of the following is high risk among the following?
A 6-year-old child with abdominal pain & red, elevated skin rashes, mainly involving the lower limbs: what is your probable diagnosis:
A 3-year-old child came with night blindness. Ophthalmology reference was done which showed the image below. This image corresponds to which stage of xeropthalmia?
During a one-minute APGAR score – the baby had 110 beats per minute, lusty cry (STRONG ENERGETIC), acrocyanosis, minimal flexion to stimulation. What is the best APGAR score?
